Text.Page: Goddess Velik, the guardian deity of Velika, wished to see you. You answered Priestess Ciebel's short questions, then were granted an audience with Velik. She warned you of a hidden threat to Velika and asked for your aid.

Mission Orders

Return to Velika at once and report to General Samael. All other orders are rescinded.

Ah, <PCNAME>. It seems that Velik herself would like to reward you for the work you've done here. Velik's high priestess, {@linkcreature:63#1167#Ciebel}, is waiting for you near the idol of the goddess. I suggest you not keep her waiting.

<PCNAME>, at last. Velik is seeking soldiers who are capable of more than simple obedience to orders. The Valkyon Federation needs champions—more than it might realize. What sort of soldier are you? <NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What do you mean?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
Are you a dutiful follower or an independent thinker?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"..."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

We understand this may be confusing, from your perspective. But the gods live and work on different timelines than mortals.

You do not have to give an answer today.

There are many steps ahead on the path to your destiny. Your answer will come to you in the fullness of time. Or not."What? I..."

When the time comes, make a decision that you will not regret.

Now, are you ready to see the goddess in her sanctuary?

. I've watched your brief, but illustrious, career with interest. You've served with courage, honor, and, most importantly, compassion.

We have need of soldiers like you.

You've returned. Remember what the goddess said to you. You must defend the city—and the Dream itself.

Return now to Samael. Farewell.
Have you met the goddess?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I have."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
You should be humbled. She doesn't meet with just anyone, you know. She must see something special in you. I wonder what. Hah!
